[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Integration: State commitment] Can aggregator value changes fail to be properly reflected in Jellyfish Merkle tree state roots, causing state divergence between validators? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Integration: Gas metering] Are aggregator operations properly gas-metered, or can free/cheap operations enable DoS through aggregator spam? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Integration: Consensus] If different validators execute aggregator operations in different orders during parallel execution, can this break consensus determinism? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Integration: Storage layer] When state_key() generates storage keys, can key collisions between different aggregators cause data corruption in AptosDB? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Integration: Snapshot materialization] Can stale snapshots be used after aggregator updates, causing double-spending or incorrect balance calculations? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Integration: Transaction ordering] Can transaction reordering in the mempool or during execution affect aggregator final values in ways that enable frontrunning? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Integration: Fungible assets] When ConcurrentFungibleBalanceResource uses AggregatorResource with u64::MAX as max_value, can this hide real overflow issues? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [All structs: Serde derive] All structs use #[derive(Serialize, Deserialize)] - can custom deserializers bypass invariant validation during state loading? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Serialization: Version compatibility] If struct fields change in future versions, can old serialized data create security vulnerabilities when deserialized? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Serialization: BCS format] Does BCS serialization prevent size bombs, deeply nested structures, or other attacks through maliciously crafted aggregator data? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Serialization: Generic types] Can serialization of generic type T lead to type confusion if T changes between serialization and deserialization? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Deserialization: Memory safety] Can deserializing extremely large aggregator structures exhaust memory and cause DoS on validator nodes? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Concurrency: No synchronization] The file contains no Mutex, RwLock, or atomic types - can concurrent access from parallel transactions cause data races? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Concurrency: Mutable references] Can multiple mutable references to AggregatorResource exist simultaneously during parallel execution, violating Rust's borrow checker at runtime? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Concurrency: Transaction isolation] Can one transaction's modifications to an aggregator be visible to concurrent transactions before commit, breaking isolation? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Concurrency: Optimistic locking] If Block-STM uses optimistic concurrency control, can aggregator conflicts cause excessive transaction aborts and liveness issues? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Concurrency: Commit ordering] Can out-of-order commits of aggregator changes cause inconsistent final state visible to subsequent transactions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Generics: Type parameter T] Without trait bounds, can T be instantiated with types that don't support arithmetic, comparison, or other required operations? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Generics: Size assumptions] Can T be a large type causing stack overflow or performance issues when AggregatorResource is copied? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Generics: Drop semantics] If T has custom Drop implementations, can they cause side effects during aggregator cleanup that violate atomicity? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Generics: Lifetime issues] Can lifetime mismatches between T and struct lifetime parameters cause use-after-free or dangling reference bugs? (High)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Economic: Supply manipulation] Can aggregator manipulation in coin supply tracking allow attackers to inflate/deflate token supplies for profit? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/types/src/account_config/resources/aggregator.rs] [Economic: Fee extraction] Can attackers exploit aggregator behavior to extract value through transaction fee manipulation or MEV? (High)
